title: Update login screen image asset (versioned) and render without cropping

requirements.summary: Add the uploaded login photo as a new versioned static asset and update AuthGate to reference it to bust cache.
acceptanceCriteria: A new static image file exists in frontend/public/assets/generated with a new, versioned filename (different from login-logo-v2.dim_512x512.jpeg) and contains the pixels from WhatsApp-Image-2020-10-24-at-11.11.10-PM-4.jpeg.
frontend/src/components/auth/AuthGate.tsx uses the new versioned asset path in the for the unauthenticated login screen.
After a hard refresh in the browser, the login screen displays the newly uploaded image (not the previously cached one).

file_operations.description: Add the uploaded image (pixels exactly from WhatsApp-Image-2020-10-24-at-11.11.10-PM-4.jpeg) as a new, versioned static asset file to bust browser cache.

Update the unauthenticated login screen to use the new asset path "/assets/generated/login-logo-v3.dim_400x600.jpeg" instead of "/assets/generated/login-logo-v2.dim_512x512.jpeg" so the new image loads after hard refresh.

requirements.summary: Ensure the AuthGate login image is displayed as-is (no crop) while staying contained within the existing 128x128 area.
acceptanceCriteria: The AuthGate login image is displayed without cropping any part of the image (e.g., uses object-contain or equivalent styling rather than object-cover).
The image remains visually contained within the existing 128x128 (h-32 w-32) area on the login card, without overflowing the layout.

file_operations.description: Change the login image Tailwind/CSS classes to avoid cropping (replace object-cover/object-top behavior with object-contain and appropriate positioning) while keeping the existing h-32 w-32 sizing and preventing overflow.
